story:
Short Summary

This campaign is about health, about kids, and about common sense. My name is Loretta, and I am a member of the Board of Directors for World's Children, an amazing organization that helps the most vulnerable children in India.

Each of the Board members are taking on a findraising task to raise funds to meet an outstanding need in our orphanages right now. I am raising $2500 to purchase mosquito nets for 160 children that are right now without them. 

Why mosquito nets? Malaria is rampant in India, and the number one way to get infected is to be bitten by an infected mosquito. There are other diseases a child can get from mosquito bites as well. Also, sleeping without a net can turn an good nights rest into a restless and fitful night with as many as 100 mosquito bites by morning. Among other things, this causes the child to be uncomfortable and unable to pay attention to their studies while in school, or to be able to feel good enough to have fun and play with the other children. 

What We Need

At about $15.62 per net, $32 will buy two nets, $78 will buy 5, $156 will buy 10, and $500 will purchase 32 mosquito nets and protect 32 children every night. We need every child to have a net covering their sleeping area. Right now I raising funds for 160 children. Won't you please help me to raise this money and protect our children from disease?

The Impact

World's Children impacts some of the world's most vulnerable children. These children are often abandoned at birth or sold into slavery due to the family's abject poverty, gender bias, or for lack of family to care for them. Most of our orphanages have many more girls than boys. Because of the culture, the dowry system, and status, girls are often seen as a hardship and are unwanted at birth.

With your help, we can provide shelter, care, education, cultural upbringing, and safety for these children. We address all quality of life issues for all the children that reach our 49 orphanges. We are continuously seeking new ways to make their lives better, and to enrich the lives of our donors through lifelong partnerships with the orphanages and the children. You get to experience the difference you make! It is quite satisfying!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially right now, won't you please send this to someone who may be interested in helping right now? Also, please sign up on our website for our newsletters. You will find the information uplifting and heartfelt, and you can keep updated on all of our projects. 

Thank you so much for your time and suport in this very important organization and project. I am doing my part to make the world a better place, one child at a time. 

All of the images in the video where taken by me during an extended stay in India visiting five orphanages. I hope you enjoyed it!

story:
Drink To Live

Most people need to eat to live but, my mom is at the point of needing to juice.  She has a disease that she's fighting and has been for the past 10 years called "Sarcoidosis".  Sarcoidosis  is a disease in which abnormal collections of chronic inflammatory cells (granulomas) form as nodules in multiple organs. The cause of sarcoidosis is unknown.  She's ONLY 48 years old, on oxygen, can't walk long distances, and can't stand for more than 3 minutes without getting dizzy.  I'm tired of this and medicine is not helping.

The doctors have her on prednisone (and a host of other medications) and it's doing nothing but, hurting her more.  Prednisone has given her osteperosis, diabetes, and shingles.  The weight gain from the medications and inability to move because of the oxygen and dizzy spells, can be fixed with juicing.  Many people have been cured or have extremely improved by juicing and turning to healthy foods for healing.

What SHE Needs

She needs to get off of these medications and heal her body but, juicing is expensive.  She is disabled and cannot afford what is needed to successfully juice for 90 days.

  • Juicing all of her meals will cost about $20 per day.
  • Also the medications have caused a lot of dental problems and she needs dentures.  Any donations that exceed the goal for juicing will go towards dental work to make her smile again.

I WILL WORK FOR IT

I am a graphics designer and I am willing to work in exchange for your help.  I can design a logo for your business in exchange for a $30 donation.  I will design your logo and business card for a $100 donation.  I will create a website for you to see her progress.  Check out some of my work:

The Impact

Like I said before, she is only 48 years old.  As her only child, I need her.  My mother has so much life to live.  When I do have children, they have to know her like I did as a child.  She was and still is the best mother in the world.  My mom has always been a giving person.  Everyone that knows her, loves her.  I just want her to be able to lose weight, get off of these dangerous medications, and smile again!  Seems simple, right?  Please help us!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, please spread the word.  Post this to your website, facebook, twitter, etc.  If you know any dental professionals or produce companies willing to contribute to this cause, it would be greatly appreciated.

story:
UPDATE -

Thank you to everyone who has supported Jayde's wheelchair fund - we have exceeded the original goal! You can still contribute until the end of May, and every bit of support helps greatly. Jayde has now ordered her new wheelchair and is eagerly awaiting its arrival. Our original goal was as low as possible, so any further contributions go directly towards the rest of the cost of the chair, helping Jayde keep some of her savings in the bank, and to set aside a fund for maintenance or repairs.

 

About Jayde

Jayde was an avid runner, training for her first half marathon in August 2008 when she suffered an extensive DVT (blood clot) in her leg, which left her permanently disabled. She has essentially lost the use of that leg, is in constant pain and now requires a wheelchair to get around. 

Jayde loved to run, but she doesn't get much of that sense of freedom anymore. She   has been largely housebound since her DVT. Her current wheelchair is heavy, cumbersome, difficult to control and painful to wheel for more than a few minutes. The hard rubber wheels and castors catch on every crack or pebble and threaten to dump her over.

What We Need 

A Litestream wheelchair with spoke wheels, mountain bike tires, natural fit push rims and a hard formed back will cost $4300.

Though Jayde is on a limited income, she is determined and has carefully saved $2650, which leaves $1650 left to be raised. 

Any contributions will help, and will go directly towards Jayde's new wheelchair. If the goal is not reached by May 31, she will have to defer the purchase by several months until she can save the rest. She'll still get the wheelchair, but will have to wait until next spring to get outside.

Alberta Aids to Daily Living (AADL) would provide some support towards a new chair, but they would then own it and (like her current chair), Jayde would not be allowed to modify or repair it. For her own sense of agency, Jayde needs to own her own wheelchair.

A Wheelchair to Change Her Life

The impact of a new chair would be huge! Imagine looking out the window and seeing a beautiful sunny day, but not being able to experience it because the world is dangerous - the whole experience would leave you exhausted, frustrated and in pain. 

That is Jayde's world.

A new wheelchair would allow Jayde to get to places that now she can only dream of. She would love to get out to her old running routes, explore Edmonton's extensive bike paths, and be healthy and active once more. To go to the farmer's markets or zoo with her son, to simply be able to move.

Summers around here are far too short! Please help Jayde get a new wheelchair as soon as possible, to hit the trails with her 13 year old son once more, rip up the bike paths, visit the parks, and start training towards her new goal of someday wheeling a marathon.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution helps, and it doesn't have to be financial. Spread the word! Please share this with anyone you can. 

Jayde is a great love in my life, and I want her to feel freedom, exhilaration and the pure joy of movement once more. Please help to give that to her, too. 

- Elizabeth

Any contribution helps, and it doesn't have to be financial. Spread the word! Please share this with anyone you can. 
Jayde is a great love in my life, and I want her to feel freedom, exhilaration and the pure joy of movement once more. Please help to give that to her, too. 
- Elizabeth

story:
Our Story

 Sweet Pea came to Cedar Rapids Animal Care and Control on Tues. August 2nd as a stray. Sweet Pea has Demodectic Mange, a staph infection in her skin and yeast infection in ears. We believe she is a Bulldog of approx 10 months old. Critter Crusaders of Cedar Rapids, a 501c3 non-profit of caring shelter volunteers have taken Sweet Pea for extensive treatment at Frey Pet hospital in Cedar Rapids. She is not a throw away. Though she is suffering, her tail wags. Her body is swollen and her skin is cracked and bleeding, yet she wants to play. How lucky are we to have animals in our lives? We owe them our time, our love and most of all, our commitment to help. If you can assist, know that we are very grateful. If you can’t, we understand, as times are difficult. Be assured we will see this little girl through- no matter what.

The Impact

Sweet Pea has severe Demodectic Mange and her skin is infected with Staph. This is a costly treatment and Pea will be hospitalized for 2-3 weeks under the care of Dr. Jennifer Feuerbach. Sweet Pea will start the healing process and then go into foster care with CC member, Tina MacNaughton. The difference that we make in the lives of these animals is our passion. Suffering gives way to health. Homelessness becomes happiness. Please help us make that difference for Pea.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $1,000 to help pay for Dr. Jennifer Feuerbach's treatment and care.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Critter Crusaders of CR
PO Box 10111
Cedar Rapids, IA. 52410

story:
My name is Kim. I am doing this fundraiser for Tyler because he and his story touched my heart. His mother is spending every minute with him, and trying to make things work out financially while he is battling cancer. I think it is terrible that a child has to fight cancer at such a delicate age. Not just a young age, but an age where life is coming together for them. I would like to take just a small amount of pressure off of Kari, his mother, by doing this fundraiser for them.

 

On June 6th, 2012 Tyler was taken to the local Emergency Room complaining of back pain. They took xrays and sent Tyler home. On June 9th, Tyler was taken back to the local ER because when he woke up he could not walk. Tyler was then sent to Mott's Childrens Hospital in Michigan. At Motts, they took alot of tests, and immediately took Tyler up to emergency surgery. The only thing Kari (mom) knew at that time was that there was a tumor wrapped around his spine, and it had to be removed. It was found that Tyler had Ewings Sarcoma, which is a rare and aggressive form of cancer.

The surgeon could not get all of the tumor, and chemotherapy needed to be started immediately. The tumor damaged his disc which has caused Tyler to have issues with his left leg and right arm.  Tyler needs to have an operation in order to fix his C7 disc in his neck, but that will have to wait. The doctors wanted Tyler to start chemo immediately.So for now, it is hard for Tyler to ride because of the discomfort in his arm and leg. He isn't able to lift his arm up and seems to, at times, not have control of his arm movements. Tyler is also wearing a neck brace until the operation can be completed.  

Tyler is to go to Mott's Childrens Hospital on Tuesdays for 48 hour chemo, and go home on either Thursday or Friday. Then he stays home for a week, then comes back to the hospital for 5 day chemo.  He was to start radiation along with chemo this week, but because of counts dropping, it was put off another week. He has to do the chemo for a year! After that year, Tyler will still have to have scans, tests, etc for the next 5 years.

As if the cancer wasn't enough,  Motts Hospital is almost a 2 hour drive one way for Tyler and his mom, Kari. They are driving this, if there are no complications, back and forth a couple of times a week. However, if Tyler gets a temperature, she has to take him in, which is what happened this past week.

It is not only tough because of the ride, or the cost of gas, but it hurts Tyler to ride. For this reason, she tries to do therapy at home with him 3x a week.

There are 5 in this family. Mom, Stepdad, and 3 children including Tyler. Tyler is a typical 14 year old boy, who really has better things to do than to be fighting cancer. It is common for teenagers fighting tumors to become depressed and angry. Tyler knows it isn't just tough on him, but on his whole family.

Tyler has a heart of gold. The nurse mentioned having the eye doctor come in to see him, and his response was that if it cost money, then to not do it. He also changed his Christmas list (there is that typical 14 year old boy, already thinking about Christmas) to used and cheap items to be able to help his parents out.

Tyler needs to be able to completely focus on fighting this cancer. No 14 year old child should have to worry about fighting cancer, but the sad reality is that it happens every day. There is nothing that we, as family, friends and facebook followers can do about fighting it for him. However, he definitely should not be worrying about finances. No matter what his parents tell him, he will worry because that is the type of HERO that he is. That is where we, family, friends and facebook followers can help.  They need help on co-pays, gas, food (when at hospital), general expenses and some fun things for Tyler to do while he is battling and conquering this monster.

If you would love to help, but just can't financially at the moment, there are ways you can still contribute, they are:

  • Research and Spread the word about Pediatric Cancer

  • Pray for Strength for Tyler

  • Share this Fundraising Page

  • "Like" and Share Tyler's Facebook Page, Tyler's B.E.S.T (Beating Ewings Sarcoma's Tush)

Research and Spread the word about Pediatric Cancer

Share this Fundraising Page


"Like" and Share Tyler's Facebook Page, Tyler's B.E.S.T (Beating Ewings Sarcoma's Tush)

story:
The Freedom Cycle System is finally available for you to pre-purchase here at Indieagogo!

In October 2012 the concept of the Freedom System was overwhelmingly voted as the Invention of the year at Australia’s premier invention awards, only weeks later it was honored with runner up at the prestigious Sydney Design Awards Since then it has been trial and error, error and trial. But the long road of testing and retesting has delivered a worthy outcome.

The thing is with this System, the only true way to understand it’s benefits, is to try it!

So, for as little as the price of a few cups of coffee or some Chinese takeaway you can be the first in the world to try this award winning system.

The What

We didn't invent freedom....but with our system we have made it possible for cyclists to enjoy it on their rides.

Freedom is a storage solution for cyclists.

The best place to carry anything on your bike is in the 'TRIANGLE' it's as out of the way as it can be on a bike, it lowers the centre of gravity and is easily accessible during your journey.

So we developed a solution to maximise the potential of this position.

The Why

The existing bottle and holder contains many 'Embedded Deficiencies'. Born in the early 1900's the bottle and holder witnessed many changes in frames, wheels, bars, tyres and much more. Yet the bottle and holder remained unchanged.

As it is. It is difficult to remove, replace and locate. It still scratches and damages every bidon we grow to like and of course it can only hold a bottle and that bottle can only be round!

We can do better!

The How

Let's keep it simple, we needed a system that could carry a round bottle where it has always been carried. But we needed a system that could be versatile and give us FREEDOM in design. The best way to achieve this was by internally fastening our bottle or element, rather than the prohibitive external cage that was full of constraint. With internal fastening, we could mount almost anything in the 'TRIANGLE'

Our pin would be 12 times smaller than the hole that was to receive it, making it easy to locate and replace. our pin would be designed with a unique holding system that would have different tensions for different rides.

Our System would be clever.

The When

The When is now...clever and growing, now available on Indieagogo. The system that has been tested by an Olympic Gold Medalist, Urban cyclist and everyone in between, and all giving us the same glowing endorsement.

It is different, yet so was the cageless pedal, the balance bike and even the smartphone.

Freedom Cycle System

 

Future Elements

 

Wind Tunnel Results

 

The below graph illustrates clearly the aerodynamic benefits of a cageless bottle system. Remove the cage and the bottle drag (Aero or Round) is reduced significantly.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.

    We are 5 young entrepreneurs from Morsø Handelsskole.

    Louise Trans Larsen - CEO 

    Anna Kjelstrup - Marketing Boss 

    Heidi Brandt Funder - Economy Boss 

    Benjamin Nyby Kibsgaard - Product Developer/Boss 

    Peter Korsgaard Svenningsen - Staff Boss 

  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.

    The idea behind the Rent-A-Sport arose when we seem that share-economy is more about just housing rental(Airbnb) and taxi driving(Uber), we feel here that we can deliver openness and flexibility for the benefit of society. 
    By providing equipment around among private consumers, so it is cheaper and easier to test new equipment and sports.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Cosmo Natural Sleep Aid: Now Available On Our Website:

https://trycosmo.com

Cosmo contains a unique combination of natural ingredients shown to help you fall asleep faster and promote deep sleep. Whereas other sleep aids only knock you out, Cosmo works with your circadian rhythm to gently guide you to sleep and help you wake up refreshed.

The result: Better quality sleep that leaves you feeling amazing the next day. 

It's like melatonin but better-- check out our ingredients:

Here's what a few of our beta testers have to say. 

All backers receive a free copy of our upcoming eBook,  "101 Ways to Sleep Better" ($10 value), filled with actionable tips such as:

  • Do's and Don'ts for better sleep
  • Figuring out how much sleep you really need
  • How to determine if you're an "early bird" or a "night owl"

Backers of the "Cosmo Ultimate Sleep Bundle" and above also receive a free ultra-soft silk sleep mask ($20 value)!

Our mission is simple: we want to help people make the most of their sleep. 

      

 

 

Disclaimer:

These statements has not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

story:
Breathe is in the News! 

 

3 easy steps to lose weight!

At Mindful Projects LLC, we are aiming to address the obesity epidemic without requiring drastic lifestyle changes. Our goal is to offer a program that empowers users with the knowledge to understand how their bodies respond to diet and exercise. Real Science. Real Results. 

Obesity, Diabetes and Heart Disease! Does this have to be the Future?

Obesity is a national crisis that threatens our society's well-being and the economy. People that are trying to lose weight or get their cholesterol levels under control are often faced with little to no scientific guidance; instead, they are flooded with new fads and "proven" techniques that promise unattainable goals. 

The most common approach is counting calories. The idea is that if one can simply "burn" more calories than they consume, then they will lose weight. The problem with the "calories in / calories out" method is that: (1) it ignores chemistry, i.e. the type of foods consumed; (2) it does not take into account changes in metabolic rate over time; and (3) it has been shown time and again not to work in the long run. Worse yet, those that cannot sustain a semi-starvation diet or extreme work-out regiment are often blamed for lacking will power. 

How does Breathe-Fit work? 

 

How does insulin tracking work? 

Your body is not your enemy and you do not have to fight against it. Your body and its mechanisms have evolved with one goal in mind: To survive! When you add some extra fat on your waist or legs, it is because the body receives signals that tells it to store away food as energy for later use. Recently, our diets have seen a surge in sugar and vegetable oils which overloads our systems and arteries and puts our body's metabolism out of balance. These extra sugars are converted into fat in the body through a hormone called insulin.

How our bodies react to sugar

What happens is that when we eat sugar, it goes into our blood stream and signals for the hormone insulin to be released. Insulin then allows the sugar to go into the cells and either become glycogen or triglycerides. Triglycerides are what the body stores as fat. 

How is CO2 Measured and why is it better?

Using a smart wearable that takes in heart rate, the app can convert the heart rate into carbon dioxide (CO2). The triglycerides mentioned earlier are eventually broken down in the body using oxygen. If you follow the breakdown of the triglycerides, you can see that they breakdown into CO2, H2O, and energy. More than 80% of that fat lose is released as carbon dioxide. Hence, by estimating the CO2 loss, it is possible to get a much more accurate representation of mass loss than the common method of counting steps.

Why are we passionate about solving the obesity epidemic?

The obesity epidemic affects everyone directly or indirectly. Heart disease and other fatal diseases directly related to diet are hovering over all of us. 

Who could benefit? 

If you are struggling with obesity and weight loss and your younger body is merely a distant memory, Breathe is for you. If you are satisfied with your overall weight but would like to lose a few pounds and then maintain your body mass, Breathe is for you. If you have recently been diagnosed with prediabetes, and your doctor recommends that you to "Do something," Breathe is for you. If you are content with your body mass and weight but would like to know how diet and exercise really work, Breathe is for you!

Breathe allows users to set their own goals. In particular, it is designed for those on the go and that have a busy lifestyle. Further, it does not require that users completely eliminate their favorite foods. Instead, it offers a custom, quantitative diet that gets results by specifically targeting the mechanisms that underlie weight gain and weight loss.   

If you do not feel like you are reaching your goals, please send us an email and we will do our best to provide feedback.  

What will we do with the funding? 

  • Right now we have invested as much as we possibly can to make an application that can have an immense effect on people's lives. We have a lot of different ideas and upgrades planned that will make losing weight even easier and even more comprehensible. 
  • Our goal to make the business model sustainable, with maintenance and updates, is to reach 15000 subscribers by June 2019.

Core Team

Amy Slozat-Crepp:  Ms. Slozat is the CEO of Mindful Projects, the creators of the Breathe-Fit phone app.  She has always been interested in maintaining a healthy lifestyle.  Prior to founding Mindful Projects, Ms. Slozat received her Masters from Edinboro University in 2007.  She earned a bachelors degree in mathematics from The Pennsylvania State University in 2003.

Justin Crepp: Dr. Justin R. Crepp is a professor of physics at the University of Notre Dame. His research involves studying the science of health management and weight loss. Prior to working at Notre Dame, Crepp was a postdoctoral scholar at the California Institute of Technology. Crepp received a PhD at the University of Florida in 2008. He earned a bachelors degree in physics from The Pennsylvania State University in 2003. 

 

Nicklas (M.Sc in Technical Entrepreneurship Candidate)

 

Christina (M.Sc in Technical Entrepreneurship Candidate)

 

Algoworks (Software Development and Consulting Firm)

 

Select the Perk that is right for you

There are three different perks you can get depending on how much you support us.  

  • Thank you for your donation.
  • Try Breathe-Fit for one month as a special tester.  Connect your smart watch and track your insulin load.  Breathe-Fit will start to learn how your body reacts to insulin and create a personalized plan.
  • Use Breathe-Fit for a year as a special tester.   Breathe-Fit will learn about your body and create a personalized plan.  The longer you use Breathe-Fit, the more custom your plan becomes.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot support us financially, we would greatly appreciate every effort to make this campaign heard and refer it to people who may find it useful. 
  • We would be happy to receive an email with any ideas, research, contacts, reviews, comments of our application. Even if you cannot support us financially, any help in fighting the obesity epidemic is a well needed support. 
  • If you feel like this is a campaign that needs more recognition, feel free to share it on social media etc. 

Thanks for supporting us! - Breathe Team

The obesity epidemic affects everyone directly or indirectly. Heart disease and other fatal diseases directly related to diet are hovering over all of us. 
Who could benefit? 

If you are struggling with obesity and weight loss and your younger body is merely a distant memory, Breathe is for you. If you are satisfied with your overall weight but would like to lose a few pounds and then maintain your body mass, Breathe is for you. If you have recently been diagnosed with prediabetes, and your doctor recommends that you to "Do something," Breathe is for you. If you are content with your body mass and weight but would like to know how diet and exercise really work, Breathe is for you!
Breathe allows users to set their own goals. In particular, it is designed for those on the go and that have a busy lifestyle. Further, it does not require that users completely eliminate their favorite foods. Instead, it offers a custom, quantitative diet that gets results by specifically targeting the mechanisms that underlie weight gain and weight loss.   
If you do not feel like you are reaching your goals, please send us an email and we will do our best to provide feedback.  
What will we do with the funding? 

Right now we have invested as much as we possibly can to make an application that can have an immense effect on people's lives. We have a lot of different ideas and upgrades planned that will make losing weight even easier and even more comprehensible. 
Our goal to make the business model sustainable, with maintenance and updates, is to reach 15000 subscribers by June 2019.

Core Team

Amy Slozat-Crepp:  Ms. Slozat is the CEO of Mindful Projects, the creators of the Breathe-Fit phone app.  She has always been interested in maintaining a healthy lifestyle.  Prior to founding Mindful Projects, Ms. Slozat received her Masters from Edinboro University in 2007.  She earned a bachelors degree in mathematics from The Pennsylvania State University in 2003.

Justin Crepp: Dr. Justin R. Crepp is a professor of physics at the University of Notre Dame. His research involves studying the science of health management and weight loss. Prior to working at Notre Dame, Crepp was a postdoctoral scholar at the California Institute of Technology. Crepp received a PhD at the University of Florida in 2008. He earned a bachelors degree in physics from The Pennsylvania State University in 2003. 
 
Nicklas (M.Sc in Technical Entrepreneurship Candidate)
 
Christina (M.Sc in Technical Entrepreneurship Candidate)
 
Algoworks (Software Development and Consulting Firm)
 

Select the Perk that is right for you
There are three different perks you can get depending on how much you support us.  

Thank you for your donation.
Try Breathe-Fit for one month as a special tester.  Connect your smart watch and track your insulin load.  Breathe-Fit will start to learn how your body reacts to insulin and create a personalized plan.
Use Breathe-Fit for a year as a special tester.   Breathe-Fit will learn about your body and create a personalized plan.  The longer you use Breathe-Fit, the more custom your plan becomes.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support us financially, we would greatly appreciate every effort to make this campaign heard and refer it to people who may find it useful. 
We would be happy to receive an email with any ideas, research, contacts, reviews, comments of our application. Even if you cannot support us financially, any help in fighting the obesity epidemic is a well needed support. 
If you feel like this is a campaign that needs more recognition, feel free to share it on social media etc. 

Thanks for supporting us! - Breathe Team

story:
MY DOG ATE MY GLASSES

Replacements are $295 so I don't need $500. 

Sort of, he chewed on them and they're now useless. I've used my allotted vision insurance for the year and am unable to pay for replacements. 
Anything  will help and is much appreciated. I'm a prime example of the flawed system. Work full time, have insurance yet strapped financially and unable to cover basic necessities.  It's a horrible place to be in and hurts my pride to even have to ask for help. 
Thanks
Adam

story:
Please Support Our

** Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign**

"Of all of the forms of inequality, injustice in health is the most shocking and most inhumane."  -Martin Luther King, Jr.

 

Hello!

Thanks for visiting our campaign page.

We are the Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign (AHAC)!

The Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign is a volunteer-run 501(c)3 that was established in 1999 and began offering alternative healthcare services to Seattle's homeless and low-income population in 2000.  Our volunteer licensed practitioners offer services such as naturopathic medicine, acupuncture, and massage at six clinics at various homeless shelters and transitional and low-income housing facilities in Seattle.At AHAC, we believe that access to quality healthcare is a right, not a privilege, and it should not be denied or limited because of economic status. Holistic healthcare practices such as acupuncture & oriental medicine, naturopathic medicine, massage therapy, clinical nutrition, botanical medicine, midwifery, and homeopathy are important options in modern healthcare and should be available to all. Homeless and low-income people have the right to participate in the creation of public policies and programs that affect their access to healthcare.

Your support is needed to help continue our holistic health services to Seattle's homeless and low-income population.

What We Need

 

We are aiming to raise $3000 to support our continued standard operations.  Funds donated will go towards the following:

  • Clinical supplies which include exam tables, massage tables, first aid supplies, acupuncture needles, exam equipment (stethoscopes, blood pressure cuffs.. etc), and privacy curtains
  • Treatment supplies which include supplements, vitamins and minerals, herbal therapies, homeopathics and nutritional supplementation.
  • Payroll funding for AHAC employees which include the Clinical Operations Manager, Volunteer Operations Manager and Executive Director.  
  • Office supplies which include upgrades to EMR software as well as new computers and internet accessibility for charting for our volunteer practitioners.
  • Homelessness 101 training for all AHAC volunteers.

"There are no words. It's beautiful. If I were a rich man, I would fund what you do... The entire world is all about business... all about money.  But this.. it is free for us. It feels like taking a shower; it feels clean. I feel like I'm flying. You've made us feel human again."  -Hana, Massage Patient, Angeline's Women's Day Shelter

The Impact of Your Contribution

 

Unfortunately, the largest and most common barrier to healthcare it cost.  Coupled with lack of knowledge about where to get treated, lack of access to transportation, embarrassment, and self-consciousness about hygiene, many homeless and low-income individuals never receive medical care. The Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign works to both provide preventative care and treatment for existing conditions, with the aim of educating low-income and homeless individuals, as well as the community, on self-care and resources for treatment.  Doing so helps to keep homeless and low-income individuals from seeking treatment in hospital emergency rooms, which is often their most effective form of care.  This type of care often lacks continuity and is expensive for both the hospitals and local government.

Since 2000, AHAC has provided over 6,000 treatments to over 2,000 patients.  Our volunteer practitioners at our clinics at Compass Cascade Women's Program and the Frye Apartments have the opportunity to work with residents throughout their stay in these transitional and low-income housing facilities, easing their transition back from life on the streets and providing them with the resources for self-care and wellness going forward.  Some of our clinics are at emergency homeless shelters, such as Peace for the Streets by Kids on the Streets (PSKS) in Capital Hill and ROOTS Young Adult Shelter in the University District. And for the past 13 years, AHAC has had the opportunity to provide holistic healthcare services to the transitory residents of Tent City 3.

For every $100 donated, we are able to provide 30-50 individuals with free healthcare.  Your contribution to our Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign helps to provide greater continuity in our offering holistic healthcare services to Seattle's homeless and low-income population. 

"The women residents at the Compass site where I provide acupuncture give to me far more than I can give to them during their treatments. They have taught me that any of us can be only a step away from falling off the edge of stability and how fortunate I am to have always had a place to call home. The women there come from all stages and walks of life, are courageous and profoundly grateful for the housing at Compass and for all the contributions people make to help them get back on their feet. Working with this population is a transforming experience."  -Nancy P. Sherman, M.Ac, L.Ac, AHAC Volunteer

Other Ways You Can Help AHAC

 

We know that not everyone can contribute financially to our mission of increasing access to healthcare for Seattle's homeless and low-income population, but that doesn't mean that we still couldn't use your help! 

  • Please consider volunteering! We are always looking for volunteers to ensure that our clinics run smoothly and our supply dispensary is maintained.  Specifically, licensed practitioner volunteers are especially in short supply.  You can visit our website for volunteer applications, or contact our Volunteer Manager at ahacseattle@gmail.com for more information about our volunteer needs.
  • Please help spread the word about our work and community goals by 'liking' us on Facebook. Doing so will also help to keep you informed about AHAC news, volunteer opportunities, supply needs, and local happenings.

story:
VISS Hair is...

  • VISS™ Hair is powered by 1Mhz Radio Frequency that released on the scalp enhances blood circulation improving it.
  • Apply the hair loss treatment serum on the scalp and massage with VISS Hair. VISS hair helps to penetrate the serum deeper into your skin and enhanced by the Radio Frequency improves the scalp micro-circulation, helping your hair to grow stronger and promoting new hair growth.
  • Viss™ Hair is a hair loss treatment device powered by 1Mhz High Radio Frequency, a 620nm infrared light and vibration massage. This rechargeable wireless device is easy to use and control anywhere and at anytime.
  • It’s provided of a cover cap for a hygienic storage of the device after usage.

 

How To Use

     To optimise the effect we suggest to treat the area with VISS Hair everyday for 5 to 10 minutes

  1. Wash and dry your hair thoroughly (Recommended use of VISS Hair is before bedtime)

  2. Apply/Spray the hair loss treatment (or water) on the scalp

  3. Turn on the device and select the treatment level (Unplug the charger while using it)

  4. Press gently the head of device on scalp and massage (the vibration and LED must be working when you’re using it the right way)

  5. Hold and press gently for 1-2 seconds where you want to treat, don’t let the vibration on the same spot for too long

  6. Wait for 5-6minutes for the serum to penetrate into your scalp. You may blow your scalp with cold air gently. If you want to go out after the treatment, use any hair products (such as wax or hairspray) after washing your hair

 

The Effect

  • VISS Hair improves the scalp blood circulation and helps in revitalizing the inactive hair follicles. This leads to a better hair growth, hair loss control, helping with thinning hair issues as well
  • VISS Hair produces 1MHz high frequency which kills any bacterias or other foreign bodies on the scalp preventing infections. The scalp has to be healthy for a healthy hair growth
  • VISS Hair ensures a better absorption of the treatment serum both hair growth serum or dandruff serum

 

Device Parts Description

  1. ​​700nm RED LED
  2. VISS HAIR RF polar
  3. Mid-low level radio frequency (Press twice for lower level)
  4. Mid-high level radio frequency ((press twice for higher level)
  5. Power button
  6. DC 6V plug insert (Micro 5pin USB)

 

Technical Specification

 

Caution - This cannot be used

  • Not suitable for children under age 14

  • If you have ask in disease such as active skin cancer, if you have a history of skin cancer or any other localized cancer in the are as to be treated

  • If your skin is sensitive to electric heat and easily develops a rash or an allergic reaction

  • If you have a pacemaker, or any other kind of implanted electronic medical device
  • Over or near anything artificial like silicon implants, Implanon contraceptive implants, pacemakers, subcutaneous injection ports (insulin dispenser) or piercings
  • If you are pregnant

story:
THANK YOU

A profound thank you to all supporters of this campaign! You have brought us an important step closer to be able to bring the benefits of Parkinson's Dance to more people in the South West.

Dance can change lives

This is never more obvious to us than in our Parkinson’s Dance Class here at Pavilion Dance South West (PDSW). 

Parkinson’s is a neurological condition that affects approximately one in every 500 people in the UK, and because there is no cure yet the diagnosis can be a terrible blow. 

Parkinson’s Dance is an alternative therapy that has not only proven to help with the physical symptoms in a fun and motivating environment, but that can also offer a lifeline out of isolation and depression. 

In 2016 we will begin a three-year project to enable as many people as possible in the South West to benefit from Parkinson’s Dance.

Having raised over £17,000 so far we are very close to hitting our target to fund the first and crucial year of the project, but have found ourselves with a shortfall of £3000. 

This is where we need your help: Please donate what you can, spread the word and help us support this life-altering project.

The project

Our Bournemouth-based Parkinson’s Dance class has been running successfully for three years. Each week around 15 dancers attend with their carers and learn how to dance, to support each other, and to have fun. Our model of Parkinson’s Dance is especially effective as the class is taught by two teachers, one of them a physiotherapist, who ensures that the participants leave every week with a noticeable improvement in balance, coordination and suppleness. 

In 2016 we will begin to roll this model out across the South West region, to enable as many people as possible affected by the condition to access its benefits, and because we believe that this approach is the most effective, while having wellbeing firmly at its core.
Over a period of three years we aim at opening six new, regular classes.

With the support of Southampton University’s Health Sciences department, the benefits of our model will be analysed and evaluated to help build a strong case for future funding, which will enable us to take it out to the very tip of the South West and beyond.

Who are we?

Pavilion Dace South West is a Bournemouth-based national dance development organisation for the South West of England. 

We work with many different groups to help as many people as possible experience dance - because dance can enrich communities, improve public health and increase people's life satisfaction.

We believe in a world where everyone leads a healthier and happier life through dance.

Find out more about our work on our website.

story:
A Growing Epidemic

If you’re reading this while looking down at your phone, tablet or computer, you probably already suffer from Tech Neck. Tech Neck is the chronic pain in the neck caused by the forward head posture formed from overuse of technology. Simply put: our muscles, ligaments and spine are not designed to support our 10 pound head in a constant forward position. 

Tech Neck Symptoms include:

  • Chronic headaches & muscle aches
  • Radiating pain
  • Numbness/tingling
  • Strained neck muscles
  • Limited mobility

These symptoms also contribute to a decrease in healthy habits of our daily life:

  • Sleep Deprivation/Fatigue
  • Anxiety
  • Poor Work Performance
  • Loss of Focus
  • Decrease of Energy
  • Digestive Issues
  • Weight Gain

If left untreated it can lead to serious and irreversible side effects such as nerve damage, arthritis and spine degeneration (aging of the neck). 

Medical studies suggest that no one is immune; Tech Neck affects everyone from middle-schoolers to people in their late 70’s and shows no signs of slowing down. And the symptoms aren’t just due to modern-age technology; Typing, reading and any other common activity done while looking down at something can trigger the side effects mentioned above.

Tech Neck is Real


"Over long periods of time, maintaining this head-forward posture can lead to muscle strain, disc injury, nerve impingement and arthritic changes of the neck—and the potential for developing ongoing neck and shoulder pain, headaches, and pain radiating down the arms."
-Spine-Health.com - 5 Simple Steps to Prevent Tech Neck
 

"But it's poor posture, and it can lead to a lot of neck pain.
This 21st Century problem is being called "tech neck," and it can be caused by straining your neck forward to see that screen. As you type out an email to a colleague or answer your boss' latest urgent request, you're holding your neck at an unnatural angle. And it stays there for much longer than it should, causing muscle strain and pain."
-SpineUniverse.com - High-Tech Can Be a Pain in the Neck
 

“We did a study on the issue of poor posture and how it affects you, especially when you’re on a cell phone or smart device,” says Hansraj, chief of spine surgery at New York Spine Surgery & Rehabilitative Medicine. “It’s a lot of load, an amazing amount of weight to be carrying around your neck....When your spine is in neutral position, the head weighs about 10-12 pounds,” he says. “At 15 degrees [forward], the neck sees 27 pounds. At 45 degrees, it sees 49 pounds, and at 60 degrees, it’s 60 pounds.”

That’s 60 pounds of weight stress on muscles and nerves that are meant to handle 10-12 pounds of stress, and that much load can do a lot of damage over time.
-WebMD.com - 'Text Neck' and Other Tech Troubles
 

Fight Technology with Technology

The ComfortAdjust pillow was designed in collaboration with medical professionals and innovative product engineers to pro-actively combat Tech Neck symptoms and re-align your posture - all while providing restorative sleep. 

Exercises and massages may help temporarily alleviate tech neck symptoms, but they aren’t enough to fully restore your body’s healthy alignment necessary for long term healing. Just as a broken bone won’t heal properly without the cast, a strained neck can’t heal properly and restore without neck support and sleep posture alignment.

ComfortAdjust both combats the neck strain of a day's worth of technology use and re-aligns your posture. It is the only pillow uniquely designed to alleviate the symptoms of tech neck while providing you with the best sleep posture alignment necessary for a restorative night’s sleep.

The first and only pillow with an adjustable patent-pending Alignment Core (like a neck roll) that can be rotated to find your optimum blend of comfort and support, fitting seamlessly inside a premium memory foam pillow that works to align, adjust and relieve strain to give you back a much-needed full night’s rest.

The Test Results are in!

We tested the ComfortAdjust Pillow against the top-selling interlocking fill pillow using an Xsensor X3 Medical Version 5.0 pressure imaging system. We tested each pillow with the same person, on the same mattress, and in the back-lying position. The results speak for themselves! ComfortAdjust Pillow is the only pillow that provides significant support in the neck area.

Different by Design

The ComfortAdjust™ Pillow is designed to provide optimal support for both BACK and SIDE sleepers (stomach sleeping is not recommended for healthy sleep posture).  It couldn't be easier to use:

STEP 1: Select either the BACK sleeper or SIDE sleeper side (the BACK sleeper side has the head well in the center)

STEP 2: Unzip the cover

STEP 3: Turn the dial until you find a comfortable setting

STEP 4: Zip the cover

STEP 5: Enjoy sweet dreams and improved sleep posture
 

A Truly Universal Pillow

Tech Neck affects everyone: children, young adults, the elderly. The ComfortAdjust pillow is for anyone who suffers from the symptoms of Tech Neck and wants to combat poor neck posture and get a better night’s sleep, which in turn can lead to an increase in energy, less pain and more focus throughout the day.

Feedback

ComfortAdjust is taking on the Tech Neck epidemic one well-rested and properly aligned consumer at a time:


What You'll Get

Each ComfortAdjust Pillow comes with the innovative Alignment Core adjustable neck support and a machine-washable cover. It fits in a STANDARD/QUEEN-sized pillow case.

We're ready to go

Your Early-Bird ComfortAdjust Pillow is guaranteed to arrive to you in December. We will begin a production run as soon as the campaign ends on November 10th.

We’ve already produced a small number of sample pillows using a production-ready tool and a great US manufacturer. Our pillow met stringent, 3rd party quality standards. Once the campaign ends, we'll start production.  The first 500 pillows should ship this December.


Why we need you

Anyone who uses technology on a daily basis needs a new pillow geometry for restorative neck support. We need your support so that we can produce a product that will truly help improve lives. Once we achieve our goal, your pillow will ship in 6-8 weeks.


The team

Having a great idea is a start. Making that idea real takes a team of dedicated people with expertise in many areas.


FAQ

How do I use the ComfortAdjust Pillow?

Your ComfortAdjust™ Pillow represents an entirely new approach to sleep alignment. You will immediately feel comfortable support when lying on the pillow for the first time, but it could take up to 30 days for your neck to completely adapt. For this reason, the ComfortAdjust™ Pillow has an integrated Alignment Core™ which can be easily adjusted to different comfort levels.

The ComfortAdjust™ Pillow’s ergonomic design thoughtfully accommodates back sleepers and side sleepers, and can improve sleep posture. Just pick your side and dial in your comfort.

The side with the mesh square is designed to align and support back sleepers. If you’re a side sleeper, just turn the pillow over for optimal alignment and support.

Can I wash the cover?

Absolutely. Carefully remove it and machine wash on cold with a mild soap. You may use a non-chlorine bleach. You must allow the cover to air dry flat.

How do I wash the pillow and/or Alignment Core?

Both of these parts should be spot cleaned with cold water and mild soap. You should never put these parts in a dryer. You must squeeze any excess water out and allow the parts to air dry.

What is the ComfortAdjust Pillow made of?

The ComfortAdjust ™ Pillow is made entirely in the USA. The memory foam component is of the highest quality. It is normal for your pillow to have a slight odor initially. This odor is not harmful. We recommend removing the cover and placing the pillow in a well-ventilated area for up to 72 hours for the odor to dissipate completely.

What size pillow case will fit the ComfortAdjust Pillow?

The ComfortAdjust ™ Pillow will fit in a STANDARD/QUEEN-sized pillow case.
story_txt:
A Growing EpidemicIf you’re reading this while looking down at your phone, tablet or computer, you probably already suffer from Tech Neck. Tech Neck is the chronic pain in the neck caused by the forward head posture formed from overuse of technology. Simply put: our muscles, ligaments and spine are not designed to support our 10 pound head in a constant forward position. Tech Neck Symptoms include:
Chronic headaches & muscle aches
Radiating pain
Numbness/tingling
Strained neck muscles
Limited mobility
These symptoms also contribute to a decrease in healthy habits of our daily life:
Sleep Deprivation/Fatigue
Anxiety
Poor Work Performance
Loss of Focus
Decrease of Energy
Digestive Issues
Weight Gain
If left untreated it can lead to serious and irreversible side effects such as nerve damage, arthritis and spine degeneration (aging of the neck). Medical studies suggest that no one is immune; Tech Neck affects everyone from middle-schoolers to people in their late 70’s and shows no signs of slowing down. And the symptoms aren’t just due to modern-age technology; Typing, reading and any other common activity done while looking down at something can trigger the side effects mentioned above.Tech Neck is Real"Over long periods of time, maintaining this head-forward posture can lead to muscle strain, disc injury, nerve impingement and arthritic changes of the neck—and the potential for developing ongoing neck and shoulder pain, headaches, and pain radiating down the arms."-Spine-Health.com - 5 Simple Steps to Prevent Tech Neck "But it's poor posture, and it can lead to a lot of neck pain.This 21st Century problem is being called "tech neck," and it can be caused by straining your neck forward to see that screen. As you type out an email to a colleague or answer your boss' latest urgent request, you're holding your neck at an unnatural angle. And it stays there for much longer than it should, causing muscle strain and pain."-SpineUniverse.com - High-Tech Can Be a Pain in the Neck “We did a study on the issue of poor posture and how it affects you, especially when you’re on a cell phone or smart device,” says Hansraj, chief of spine surgery at New York Spine Surgery & Rehabilitative Medicine. “It’s a lot of load, an amazing amount of weight to be carrying around your neck....When your spine is in neutral position, the head weighs about 10-12 pounds,” he says. “At 15 degrees [forward], the neck sees 27 pounds. At 45 degrees, it sees 49 pounds, and at 60 degrees, it’s 60 pounds.”That’s 60 pounds of weight stress on muscles and nerves that are meant to handle 10-12 pounds of stress, and that much load can do a lot of damage over time.-WebMD.com - 'Text Neck' and Other Tech Troubles Fight Technology with TechnologyThe ComfortAdjust pillow was designed in collaboration with medical professionals and innovative product engineers to pro-actively combat Tech Neck symptoms and re-align your posture - all while providing restorative sleep. Exercises and massages may help temporarily alleviate tech neck symptoms, but they aren’t enough to fully restore your body’s healthy alignment necessary for long term healing. Just as a broken bone won’t heal properly without the cast, a strained neck can’t heal properly and restore without neck support and sleep posture alignment.ComfortAdjust both combats the neck strain of a day's worth of technology use and re-aligns your posture. It is the only pillow uniquely designed to alleviate the symptoms of tech neck while providing you with the best sleep posture alignment necessary for a restorative night’s sleep.The first and only pillow with an adjustable patent-pending Alignment Core (like a neck roll) that can be rotated to find your optimum blend of comfort and support, fitting seamlessly inside a premium memory foam pillow that works to align, adjust and relieve strain to give you back a much-needed full night’s rest.The Test Results are in!We tested the ComfortAdjust Pillow against the top-selling interlocking fill pillow using an Xsensor X3 Medical Version 5.0 pressure imaging system. We tested each pillow with the same person, on the same mattress, and in the back-lying position. The results speak for themselves! ComfortAdjust Pillow is the only pillow that provides significant support in the neck area.Different by DesignThe ComfortAdjust™ Pillow is designed to provide optimal support for both BACK and SIDE sleepers (stomach sleeping is not recommended for healthy sleep posture).  It couldn't be easier to use:STEP 1: Select either the BACK sleeper or SIDE sleeper side (the BACK sleeper side has the head well in the center)STEP 2: Unzip the coverSTEP 3: Turn the dial until you find a comfortable settingSTEP 4: Zip the coverSTEP 5: Enjoy sweet dreams and improved sleep posture A Truly Universal PillowTech Neck affects everyone: children, young adults, the elderly. The ComfortAdjust pillow is for anyone who suffers from the symptoms of Tech Neck and wants to combat poor neck posture and get a better night’s sleep, which in turn can lead to an increase in energy, less pain and more focus throughout the day.FeedbackComfortAdjust is taking on the Tech Neck epidemic one well-rested and properly aligned consumer at a time:What You'll GetEach ComfortAdjust Pillow comes with the innovative Alignment Core adjustable neck support and a machine-washable cover. It fits in a STANDARD/QUEEN-sized pillow case.We're ready to goYour Early-Bird ComfortAdjust Pillow is guaranteed to arrive to you in December. We will begin a production run as soon as the campaign ends on November 10th.We’ve already produced a small number of sample pillows using a production-ready tool and a great US manufacturer. Our pillow met stringent, 3rd party quality standards. Once the campaign ends, we'll start production.  The first 500 pillows should ship this December.
Why we need you
Anyone who uses technology on a daily basis needs a new pillow geometry for restorative neck support. We need your support so that we can produce a product that will truly help improve lives. Once we achieve our goal, your pillow will ship in 6-8 weeks.
The team
Having a great idea is a start. Making that idea real takes a team of dedicated people with expertise in many areas.
FAQHow do I use the ComfortAdjust Pillow?Your ComfortAdjust™ Pillow represents an entirely new approach to sleep alignment. You will immediately feel comfortable support when lying on the pillow for the first time, but it could take up to 30 days for your neck to completely adapt. For this reason, the ComfortAdjust™ Pillow has an integrated Alignment Core™ which can be easily adjusted to different comfort levels.The ComfortAdjust™ Pillow’s ergonomic design thoughtfully accommodates back sleepers and side sleepers, and can improve sleep posture. Just pick your side and dial in your comfort.The side with the mesh square is designed to align and support back sleepers. If you’re a side sleeper, just turn the pillow over for optimal alignment and support.Can I wash the cover?Absolutely. Carefully remove it and machine wash on cold with a mild soap. You may use a non-chlorine bleach. You must allow the cover to air dry flat.How do I wash the pillow and/or Alignment Core?Both of these parts should be spot cleaned with cold water and mild soap. You should never put these parts in a dryer. You must squeeze any excess water out and allow the parts to air dry.What is the ComfortAdjust Pillow made of?The ComfortAdjust ™ Pillow is made entirely in the USA. The memory foam component is of the highest quality. It is normal for your pillow to have a slight odor initially. This odor is not harmful. We recommend removing the cover and placing the pillow in a well-ventilated area for up to 72 hours for the odor to dissipate completely.What size pillow case will fit the ComfortAdjust Pillow?The ComfortAdjust ™ Pillow will fit in a STANDARD/QUEEN-sized pillow case.

story:
I am riding my bike from NYC to Montreal!

 

Why?

I’m raising money for the Desmoid Tumor Research Foundation in memory of my dear friend, Jeanienne Palmer, who passed away two years ago as a result of Desmoid tumor complications.

What are Desmoid Tumors

Desmoid tumors are tumors that arise from cells called fibroblasts. Fibroblasts are found throughout our body and their main function is to provide structural support and protection to the vital organs such as lung, liver, blood vessels, heart, kidneys, skin, intestines etc. and they also play a critical role in wound healing. When fibroblast cells undergo mutations they can become cancerous and become desmoid tumors (also known as "aggressive fibromatosis"). Desmoid tumors can arise in virtually any part of the body. These tumors often occur in women in their 30's, but can occur in anyone at any age. Desmoid tumors can be slow growing or extremely aggressive. They do not metastasize (move from one body part to another), and if slow growing they can be carefully watched by your physician. However, when they are aggressive they can cause life threatening problems or even death when they compress vital organs such as intestines, kidney, lungs, blood vessels, nerves etc.

Learn more about the disease here:  http://www.dtrf.org/dtrf_index.html

 

There is no single accepted medical treatment for desmoid tumors. Numerous reports of individual cases show shrinkage or stabilization of tumor size or at least improvement in symptoms after a very wide variety of treatments.  Chemotherapy is a chemical drug that is usually injected in the veins.  A few chemotherapies that are commonly used include: doxorubicin, Doxil, dacarbazine, methotrexate, vinorelbine and vinblastine.  These are toxic chemotherapies that can have a wide range of short and long term side effects.  There have also been anecdotal reports of using sulindac (non-steroidal anti-inflammatory) or anti-hormonal agents such as tamoxifen, however the true efficacy of these drugs have not been investigated in clinical trials.

New Drugs: There are a few sarcoma centers in the country that are dedicated to understanding desmoid tumors and coming up with a cure.  A new class of agents called tyrosine kinase inhibitors (such as Gleevec) have shown to be of benefit in some desmoid tumors.  Recently there was remarkable activity noted in sorafenib (Nexavar) and a clinical trial is currently under planning.  The benefit of these newer agents are that they are oral pills and are more tolerable than cytotoxic chemotherapies.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Folks, we need money for research. Your money will be given to the Desmoid Tumor Research Foundation so that doctors and medical proffesionals can learn more about how to stop the disease.
